Overload.descr: Sets the length of an Array. Example: var aGroups: array of Integer; SetLength(aGroups, 20);
Returns the length of an Array.
Occurs when a player places a beacon on the map.
Occurs when player built a field.

Occurs when the player would be shown a message about a group being hungry (when they first get hungry, then every 4 minutes after that if there are still hungry group members). Occurs regardless of whether the group has hunger messages enabled or not.
Occurs when the group gets order to attack house
Occurs when the group gets order to attack unit
Occurs when the group1 gets order to link to group2
Occurs when the group gets order to split

Occurs after a house is destroyed and has been completely removed from the game, meaning the area it previously occupied can be used. If you need more information about the house use the OnHouseDestroyed event.
Occurs when player has built a house.
Occurs when a house is damaged by the enemy soldier. Attacker is -1 the house was damaged some other way, such as from Actions.HouseAddDamage.

Occurs when a house is destroyed. If DestroyerIndex is -1 the house was destroyed some other way, such as from Actions.HouseDestroy. If DestroyerIndex is the same as the house owner (States.HouseOwner), the house was demolished by the player who owns it. Otherwise it was destroyed by an enemy. Called just before the house is destroyed so HouseID is usable only during this event, and the area occupied by the house is still unusable.

Param.name: aDestroyerIndex: Integer; //Index of player who destroyed it

Overload.descr: Occurs when house plan is digged.
Occurs when player has placed a house plan.
Occurs when player has removed a house plan.
Occurs when a trade happens in a market (at the moment when resources are exchanged by serfs).
Occurs immediately after the mission is loaded.
Occurs when player has placed a field plan.
Occurs when player has removed a field plan.
Occurs when road plan is digged.
Occurs when player has placed a road plan.
Occurs when player has removed a road plan.
Occurs when winefield is digged
Occurs when player has placed a wine field plan.
Occurs when player has removed a wine field plan.
Occurs when certain player has been defeated. Defeat conditions are checked separately by Player AI.
Occurs when certain player is declared victorious. Victory conditions are checked separately by Player AI.
Occurs when player built a road.
Occurs every game logic update.

Occurs after a unit has died and has been completely removed from the game, meaning the tile it previously occupied can be used. If you need more information about the unit use the OnUnitDied event. Note: Because units have a death animation there is a delay of several ticks between OnUnitDied and OnUnitAfterDied.
Happens when a unit is attacked (shot at by archers or hit in melee). Attacker is always a warrior (could be archer or melee). This event will occur very frequently during battles.

Param.name: aAttacker: Integer; //Warrior who attacked the unit

Overload.descr: Occurs when a unit dies. If KillerIndex is -1 the unit died from another cause such as hunger or Actions.UnitKill. Called just before the unit is killed so UnitID is usable only during this event, and the tile occupied by the unit is still taken.

Param.name: aKillerOwner: Integer; //Index of player who killed it

Overload.descr: Occurs when player trains a unit.
Happens when unit is wounded. Attacker can be a warrior, recruit in tower or unknown (-1).

Param.name: aAttacker: Integer; //Unit who attacked the unit

Overload.descr: Occurs when resource is produced for specified house.
Occurs when player equips a warrior.
Occurs when warrior walk
Occurs when player built a winefield.
Gets AI auto attack range. Returns -1 if used with wrong parameters
Gets whether the AI should build and manage his own village Returns False if used with wrong parameters
Gets whether the AI should position his soldiers automatically Returns False if used with wrong parameters
Gets whether the AI should automatically repair damaged buildings Returns False if used with wrong parameters
Gets whether AI should defend units and houses of allies as if they were its own Returns False if used with wrong parameters
Gets the warriors equip rate for AI. Returns -1 if used with wrong parameters

Gets the formation the AI uses for defence positions for specified player and group type GroupType: 0 = Melee, 1 = AntiHorse, 2 = Ranged, 3 = Mounted group count and columns are returned in aCount and aColumns variables
Gets the number of ticks before the specified AI will start training recruits Returns -1 if used with wrong parameters
Gets the number of recruits the AI will keep in each barracks Returns -1 if used with wrong parameters
Gets the number of serfs the AI will train per house. Can be a decimal (0.25 for 1 serf per 4 houses) Returns -1 if used with wrong parameters
Gets the maximum number of soldiers the AI will train, or -1 for unlimited Returns -2 if used with wrong parameters
Gets the AI start position which is used for targeting AI attacks Returns (-1;-1) if used with wrong parameters
Gets the maximum number of laborers the AI will train Returns -1 if used with wrong parameters
Returns the group of the specified player and group type that is closest to the specified coordinates, or -1 if no such group was found. If the group type is -1 any group type will be accepted
Returns the group of the specified player and group types that is closest to the specified coordinates, or -1 if no such group was found. The group types is a ''set of Byte'', for example [1,3]

Param.name: aGroupTypes: set of Byte; //Set of group types

Overload.descr: Returns the house of the specified player and house type that is closest to the specified coordinates, or -1 if no such house was found. If the house type is -1 any house type will be accepted
Returns the house of the specified player and house types that is closest to the specified coordinates, or -1 if no such house was found. The house types is a ''set of Byte'', for example [11,13,21]

Param.name: aHouseTypes: set of Byte; //Set of house types

Overload.descr: Returns the unit of the specified player and unit type that is closest to the specified coordinates, or -1 if no such unit was found. If the unit type is -1 any unit type will be accepted
Returns the unit of the specified player and unit types that is closest to the specified coordinates, or -1 if no such unit was found. The unit types is a ''set of Byte'', for example [0,9]

Param.name: aUnitTypes: set of Byte; //Set of unit types

Overload.descr: Check if two tiles are connected by walkable road
Check if two tiles are connected by a walkable route
Check if a tile is revealed in fog of war for a player
Get the number of game ticks since mission start
Returns true if target Group is assigned to the Defence Position at coordinates X, Y
Returns the ID of the group of the unit on the specified tile or -1 if no group exists there
Returns the number of columns (units per row) of the specified group
Returns true if the group is dead (all members dead or joined other groups)
Returns true if specified group is idle (has no orders/action)

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal = "Integer" descr = "Returns the unit ID of the specified group member. Member 0 will be the flag holder, 1...GroupMemberCount-1 will be the other members (0 <= MemberIndex <= GroupMemberCount-1)">

Overload.descr: Returns the total number of members of the specified group
Returns the owner of the specified group or -1 if Group ID invalid
Returns the type of the specified group or -1 if Group ID invalid
Returns the ID of the house at the specified location or -1 if no house exists there
Returns X coordinate of Rally Point of specified barracks or 0 if BarracksID is invalid
Returns Y coordinate of Rally Point of specified barracks or 0 if BarracksID is invalid
Returns building progress of the specified house
Returns true if the specified house can reach the resources that it mines (coal, stone, fish, etc.)
Returns the damage of the specified house or -1 if House ID invalid
Returns true if the specified house has delivery disabled
Returns delivery mode ID, where ID = 0 delivery blocked ID = 1 delivery allowed ID = 2 take ware out allowed if no house was found then ID = 1 is returned
Returns true if the house is destroyed
Returns House Flag Point of specified house or KMPoint(0,0) if aHouseId is invalid
Returns true if the specified house currently has an occupant
Returns true if the specified house is fully built
Returns the owner of the specified house or -1 if House ID invalid
Returns the X coordinate of the specified house or -1 if House ID invalid
Returns the Y coordinate of the specified house or -1 if House ID invalid
Returns true if the specified house has repair enabled
Returns the amount of the specified resource in the specified house
Returns the unit type in the specified slot of the school queue. Slot 0 is the unit currently training, slots 1..5 are the queue.
Returns true if specified WIP house area is digged
Returns Max amount of gold which is possible to deliver into the TownHall or -1 if TownHall house was not found
Returns the type of the specified house
Returns max health of the specified house type

Returns the the translated name of the specified house type. Note: To ensure multiplayer consistency the name is returned as a number encoded within a markup which is decoded on output, not the actual translated text. Therefore string operations like LowerCase will not work.
Returns the type of unit that should occupy the specified type of house, or -1 if no unit should occupy it.
Returns true if the specified player can build the specified house type (unlocked and allowed).
Returns true if the specified ware in the specified storehouse or barracks is blocked
Returns the number of the specified weapon ordered to be produced in the specified house
Returns true if the specified woodcutter's hut is on chop-only mode
Returns woodcutter mode value for the specified woodcutter's hut Possible values for woodcutter mode are: 0 - Chop And Plant 1 - Chop only 2 - Plant only
Returns true if the specified player has a corn field at the specified location. If player index is -1 it will return true if any player has a corn field at the specified tile
Returns true if the specified player has a road at the specified location. If player index is -1 it will return true if any player has a road at the specified tile
Returns true if the specified player has a winefield at the specified location. If player index is -1 it will return true if any player has a winefield at the specified tile

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal = "Single" descr = "Returns a random single (float) such that: 0 <= Number < 1.0">
<Overload retVal = "Integer" descr = "Returns a random integer such that: 0 <= Number">

Overload.descr: Returns the number of player locations available on the map (including AIs), regardless of whether the location was taken in multiplayer (use PlayerEnabled to check if a location is being used)
Returns the height of the map
Returns the height of the terrain at the top left corner (vertex) of the tile at the specified XY coordinates.

Returns the terrain object ID on the tile at the specified XY coordinates. Object IDs can be seen in the map editor on the objects tab. Object 61 is ''block walking''. If there is no object on the tile, the result will be 255.
Returns true if specified tile has requested passability.

Param.name: aPassability: Byte; //passability index as listed in KM_Defaults (starts from 0)

Overload.descr: Returns the rotation of the tile at the specified XY coordinates.
Returns the tile type ID of the tile at the specified XY coordinates. Tile IDs can be seen by hovering over the tiles on the terrain tiles tab in the map editor.
Returns the width of the map
Returns type of FromWare in specified market, or -1 if no ware is selected

Returns the factor of resources lost during market trading, used to calculate the TradeRatio (see explanation in MarketValue). This value is constant within one KaM Remake release, but may change in future KaM Remake releases
Returns trade order amount in specified market
Returns type of ToWare in specified market, or -1 if no ware is selected

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal = "Single" descr = "Returns the relative market value of the specified resource type, which is a rough indication of the cost to produce that resource. These values are constant within one KaM Remake release, but may change in future KaM Remake releases. The TradeRatio is calculated as: MarketLossFactor * MarketValue(To) / (MarketValue(From). If the TradeRatio is >= 1, then the number of From resources required to receive 1 To resource is: Round(TradeRatio). If the trade ratio is < 1 then the number of To resources received for trading 1 From resource is: Round(1 / TradeRatio)">

Overload.descr: Returns mission difficulty for current game
Length of peacetime in ticks (multiplayer)
Check how player 1 feels towards player 2 (order matters). Returns true for ally, false for enemy
Get players color as text in hex format
See if player was defeated
Will be false if nobody selected that location in multiplayer
Returns an array with IDs for all the groups of the specified player
Returns an array with IDs for all the houses of the specified player
Returns an array with IDs for all the units of the specified player
Wherever player is controlled by AI
Get name of player as a string (for multiplayer)
See if player is victorious
Returns the ware distribution for the specified resource, house and player
How many defence positions AI player has. Useful for scripts like ''if not enough positions and too much groups then add a new position''
How many military units player has
How many citizen player has
Returns number of specified house types for specified player.

Param.name: aTypes: set of Byte; //House types eg. [11, 13, 21]

Overload.descr: Returns the total number of the specified house type for the specified player.
Specified house type plans count
How many active players there are.
Returns the number of the specified resource produced by the specified player
Returns the number of the specified resource types produced by the specified player.

Param.name: aTypes: set of Byte; //Set of ware types eg. [8, 10, 13, 27] for food

Overload.descr: Returns the number of units of the specified player
Returns the number of the specified unit killed by the specified player
Returns the number of the specified unit types killed by the specified player.
Returns the number of the specified unit lost by the specified player
Returns the number of the specified unit types lost by the specified player.

Param.name: aTypes: set of Byte; //Set of unit types eg. [0, 5, 13]

Overload.descr: Returns number of specified unit types for specified player.

Param.name: aTypes: set of Byte; //Set of unit types eg. [0, 5, 13]

Overload.descr: Returns number of specified unit type for specified player
Returns the ID of the unit on the specified tile or -1 if no unit exists there
Returns the ware a serf is carrying, or -1 if the unit is not a serf or is not carrying anything
Returns true if the unit is dead
Returns the direction the specified unit is facing
Returns the 'Dismissable' status of specified unit
Returns the ID of the house which is the home of the specified unit or -1 if the unit does not have a home
Returns current hitpoints for specified unit or -1 if Unit ID invalid
See if unit is invulnerable
Returns max hitpoints for specified unit or -1 if Unit ID invalid
Returns the hunger level of the specified unit as number of ticks until death or -1 if Unit ID invalid
Returns true if specified unit is idle (has no orders/action)
Gives the hunger level when a unit will try to eat in ticks until death
Gives the maximum hunger level a unit can have in ticks until death
Returns the owner of the specified unit or -1 if Unit ID invalid
Returns the X coordinate of the specified unit or -1 if Unit ID invalid
Returns the Y coordinate of the specified unit or -1 if Unit ID invalid
Returns the group that the specified unit (warrior) belongs to or -1 if it does not belong to a group
Returns the type of the specified unit

Returns the the translated name of the specified unit type. Note: To ensure multiplayer consistency the name is returned as a number encoded within a markup which is decoded on output, not the actual translated text. Therefore string operations like LowerCase will not work.

Returns the the translated name of the specified ware type. Note: To ensure multiplayer consistency the name is returned as a number encoded within a markup which is decoded on output, not the actual translated text. Therefore string operations like LowerCase will not work.

Add AI attack aPlayer - playerID aRepeating - is attack repeating aDelay - attack delay aTotalMen - total soldiers to attack aMelleCount, aAntiHorseCount, aRangedCount, aMountedCount - soldiers groups count aRandomGroups - use random groups for attack aTarget - attack target of TKMAIAttackTarget type. Possible values: TKMAIAttackTarget = ( attClosestUnit, //Closest enemy unit attClosestBuildingFromArmy, //Closest building from the group lauching the attack attClosestBuildingFromStartPos, //Closest building from the AI's start position attCustomPosition //Custom point defined with aCustomPosition );aCustomPosition - TKMPoint for custom position of attack. Used if att_CustomPosition was set up as attack target Result: Attack Id, that could be used to remove this attack later on
Remove AI attack by attack ID
Remove all AI attacks
Sets AI auto attack range. AI groups will automatically attack if you are closer than this many tiles.
Sets whether the AI should build and manage his own village
Sets whether the AI should position his soldiers automatically
Sets whether the AI should automatically repair damaged buildings
Adds a defence position for the specified AI player
Removes defence position at X, Y
Removes all defence positions for specified AI player
Sets whether AI should defend units and houses of allies as if they were its own
Sets the warriors equip rate for AI.
Sets the formation the AI uses for defence positions
Sets the number of ticks before the specified AI will start training recruits
Sets the number of recruits the AI will keep in each barracks
Sets the number of serfs the AI will train per house. Can be a decimal (0.25 for 1 serf per 4 houses)
Sets the maximum number of soldiers the AI will train, or -1 for unlimited
Sets the AI start position which is used for targeting AI attacks
Sets the maximum number of laborers the AI will train
Exits cinematic mode
Pans the center of the player's screen to the given location over a set number of ticks. If Duration = 0 then the screen moves instantly.
Puts the player in cinematic mode, blocking user input and allowing the screen to be panned
Covers (un-reveals) the entire map in fog of war for player
Reveals a circle in fog of war for player
Covers a rectangular area in fog of war for player
Reveals the entire map in fog of war for player
Reveals a circle in fog of war for player
Reveals a rectangular area in fog of war for player
Adds an animal to the game and returns the unit ID or -1 if the animal was not able to be added
Adds finished field and returns true if field was successfully added
Sets field age if tile is corn field, or adds finished field and sets its age if tile is empty, and returns true if this was successfully done

Param.name: aStage: Byte; //0..6, sets the field growth stage. 0 = empty field; 6 = corn has been cut
aRandomAge: Boolean; //RandomAge sets FieldAge to random, according to specified stage. Makes fields more realistic

Overload.descr: Give player group of warriors and return the group ID or -1 if the group was not able to be added
Give player a built house and returns the house ID or -1 if the house was not able to be added
Give player a digged house area and returns House ID or -1 if house site was not able to be added. If AddMaterials = True, wood and stone will be added
Adds finished road and returns true if road was successfully added
Give player a single citizen and returns the unit ID or -1 if the unit was not able to be added
Adds amount of wares to players 1st Store
Adds amount of weapons to players 1st Barracks
Disables (Disable = True) or enables (Disable = False) control over specifed warriors group
Sets whether the specified group will alert the player when they become hungry (true to disable hunger messages, false to enable them)
Set hunger level for all group members
Kills all members of the specified group
Order the specified group to attack the specified house
Order the specified group to attack the specified unit
Order the specified group to request food
Order the specified group to halt
Order the first specified group to link to the second specified group
Order the specified group to split in half. Return the newly create group ID or -1 if splitting failed (e.g. only 1 member)
Splits specified unit from the group. Returns the newly create group ID or -1 if splitting failed (e.g. only 1 member)
Order the specified group to storm attack
Order the specified group to walk somewhere
Sets the number of columns (units per row) for the specified group
Add building materials to the specified WIP house area
Add 5 points of building progress to the specified WIP house area
Add damage to the specified house
Reduces damage to the specified house
Add wares to the specified house
Sets whether the player is allowed to build the specified house. Note: The house must still be unlocked normally (e.g. sawmill for farm), use HouseUnlock to override that.
Equips the specified unit from the specified barracks. Returns the number of units successfully equipped.
Adds a recruit inside the specified barracks
Sets delivery blocking for the specified house
Sets delivery mode for the specified house Possible values for aDeliveryMode parameter: 0 - Delivery closed 1 - Delivery allowed 2 - Take resource out
Destroys the specified house. Silent means the house will not leave rubble or play destroy sound
Sets whether the specified house displays unoccupied messages to the player
Enables house repair for the specified house
Adds the specified unit to the specified school's queue. Returns the number of units successfully added to the queue.
Removes the unit from the specified slot of the school queue. Slot 0 is the unit currently training, slots 1..5 are the queue.
Remove wares from the specified house. If a serf was on the way to pick up the ware, the serf will abandon his task
Set TownHall Max Gold parameter (how many gold could be delivered in it)
Allows player to build the specified house even if they don't have the house built that normally unlocks it (e.g. sawmill for farm). Note: Does not override blocked houses, use HouseAllow for that.
Blocks a specific ware in a storehouse or barracks
Sets the amount of the specified weapon ordered to be produced in the specified house
Sets whether a woodcutter's hut is on chop-only mode
Sets woodcutter's hut woodcutter mode Possible values for aWoodcutterMode parameter are: 0 - Chop And Plant 1 - Chop only 2 - Plant only

Writes a line of text to the game log file. Useful for debugging. Note that many calls to this procedure will have a noticeable performance impact, as well as creating a large log file, so it is recommended you don't use it outside of debugging

Sets the height of the terrain at the top left corner (vertex) of the tile at the specified XY coordinates. Returns true if the change succeeded or false if it failed. The change will fail if it would cause a unit to become stuck or a house to be damaged

Sets the terrain object on the tile at the specified XY coordinates. Object IDs can be seen in the map editor on the objects tab. Object 61 is ''block walking''. To set no object, use object type 255. Returns true if the change succeeded or false if it failed. The change will fail if it would cause a unit to become stuck or a house/field to be damaged

Sets array of tiles info, with possible change of 1. terrain (tile type) and/or rotation (same as for MapTileSet), 2. tile height (same as for MapTileHeightSet) 3. tile object (same as for MapTileObjectSet) Works much faster, then applying all changes successively for every tile, because pathfinding compute is executed only once after all changes have been done TKMTerrainTileBrief = record X, Y: Byte; // Tile map coordinates Terrain: Byte; // Terrain tile type (0..255) Rotation: Byte; // Tile rotation (0..3) Height: Byte; // Heigth (0..100) Obj: Byte; // Object (0..255) ChangeSet: TKMTileChangeTypeSet; // Set of changes. end; TKMTileChangeTypeSet = set of TKMTileChangeType TKMTileChangeType = (tctTerrain, tctRotation, tctHeight, tctObject)ChangeSet determines what should be changed on tile F.e. if we want to change terrain type and height, then ChangeSet should contain tctTerrain and tctHeight Note: aTiles elements should start from 0, as for dynamic array. So f.e. to change map tile 1,1 we should set aTiles[0][0]. Note: Errors are shown as map tiles (f.e. for error while applying aTiles[0][0] tile there will be a message with for map tile 1,1) Returns true, if there was no errors on any tile. False if there was at least 1 error.

Param.name: aTiles: array of TKMTerrainTileBrief; //Check detailed info on this type in description

aRevertOnFail: Boolean; //do we need to revert all changes on any error while applying changes. If True, then no changes will be applied on error. If False - we will continue apply changes where possible
aShowDetailedErrors: Boolean; //show detailed errors after. Can slow down the execution, because of logging. If aRevertOnFail is set to True, then only first error will be shown

Overload.descr: Sets array of tiles info, like MapTilesArraySet, but parameters are passed as an TAnsiStringArray instead of array of TKMTerrainTileBrief. This function is useful if you need to create dynamic map from scratch. Array must contain strings in following format: 'X,Y,Terrain,Rotation,Height,Obj' f.e. '1,1,20,2,87,12' In case of invalid structure detection / failed variable parsing you can find detailed errors in LOG file. If you need to skip terrain or rotation/height/obj use -1 as parameter f.e. Skipping rotation for tile [7,2]: '7,2,20,-1,87,12' Skipping obj for tile [7,2]: '7,2,20,2,87,-1' Skipping height for tile [7,2]: '7,2,20,2,-1,5' etc.

Sets the tile type and rotation at the specified XY coordinates. Tile IDs can be seen by hovering over the tiles on the terrain tiles tab in the map editor. Returns true if the change succeeded or false if it failed. The change will fail if it would cause a unit to become stuck or a house/field to be damaged
Sets the trade in the specified market
Appends to text overlaid on top left of screen. If the player index is -1 it will be appended for all players.
Appends to text overlaid on top left of screen with formatted arguments (same as Format function). If the player index is -1 it will be appended for all players.

Param.name: Params: array of const; //Array of arguments

Overload.descr: Sets text overlaid on top left of screen. If the player index is -1 it will be set for all players.
Sets text overlaid on top left of screen with formatted arguments (same as Format function). If the player index is -1 it will be set for all players.

Param.name: Params: array of const; //Array of arguments

Overload.descr: Adds a corn field plan. Returns true if the plan was successfully added or false if it failed (e.g. tile blocked)
Adds a road plan. Returns true if the plan was successfully added or false if it failed (e.g. tile blocked)
Adds a road plan. Returns true if the plan was successfully added or false if it failed (e.g. tile blocked)
Adds a wine field plan. Returns true if the plan was successfully added or false if it failed (e.g. tile blocked)
Connects road plans between two points like AI builder and returns True if road plan was successfully added. If CompletedRoad = True, road will be added instead of plans
Removes house, road or field plans from the specified tile for the specified player Returns true if the plan was successfully removed or false if it failed (e.g. tile blocked)
Add default goals/lost goals for the specified player. If the parameter buildings is true the goals will be important buildings. Otherwise it will be troops.
Change whether player1 is allied to player2. If Compliment is true, then it is set both ways (so also whether player2 is allied to player1)
Proclaims player defeated
Sets whether player A shares his beacons with player B. Sharing can still only happen between allied players, but this command lets you disable allies from sharing.

Sets whether player A shares his vision with player B (one way, for both ways use PlayerShareFogCompliment). Sharing can still only happen between allied players, but this command lets you disable allies from sharing.
Sets whether players A and B share their vision (both ways). Sharing can still only happen between allied players, but this command lets you disable allies from sharing.
Sets ware distribution for the specified resource, house and player.
Set specified player(s) victorious, and all team members of those player(s) if the 2nd parameter TeamVictory is set to true. All players who were not set to victorious are set to defeated.

Param.name: aVictors: array of Integer; //Array of player IDs

Overload.descr: Plays OGG audio file. If the player index is -1 the sound will be played to all players. Mono and stereo OGG files are supported. OGG file goes in mission folder named: Mission Name.filename.ogg

Plays OGG audio file at a location on the map. If the player index is -1 the sound will be played to all players. Radius specifies approximately the distance at which the sound can no longer be heard (normal game sounds use radius 32). Only mono OGG files are supported. OGG file goes in mission folder named: Mission Name.filename.ogg. Will not play if the location is not revealed to the player. Higher volume range is allowed than PlayOGG as positional sounds are quieter

Plays looped audio file at a location on the map. If the player index is -1 the sound will be played to all players. aRadius specifies approximately the distance at which the sound can no longer be heard (normal game sounds use aRadius 32). Only mono OGG files are supported. OGG file goes in mission folder named: Mission Name.filename.ogg. Will not play if the location is not revealed to the player (will start playing automatically when it is revealed). Higher aVolume range is allowed than PlayOGG as positional sounds are quieter. The sound will continue to loop if the game is paused and will restart automatically when the game is loaded.
Same as PlayOGG except music will fade then mute while the OGG is playing, then fade back in afterwards. You should leave a small gap at the start of your OGG file to give the music time to fade

Plays looped OGG audio file. If the player index is -1 the sound will be played to all players. Mono or stereo OGG files are supported. OGG file goes in mission folder named: Mission Name.filename.ogg. The sound will continue to loop if the game is paused and will restart automatically when the game is loaded.

Plays audio file. If the player index is -1 the sound will be played to all players. Possible to specify Looped or FadeMusic parameter Mono and stereo WAV and OGG files are supported. To specify audio format use af_Wav or af_Ogg WAV file goes in mission folder named: Mission Name.filename.wav. OGG file goes in mission folder named: Mission Name.filename.ogg If MusicFaded then sound will fade then mute while the file is playing, then fade back in afterwards. If looped, the sound will continue to loop if the game is paused and will restart automatically when the game is loaded.

Plays audio file at a location on the map. If the player index is -1 the sound will be played to all players. Possible to specify Looped or FadeMusic parameter aRadius specifies approximately the distance at which the sound can no longer be heard (normal game sounds use aRadius 32). Only mono WAV or OGG files are supported. To specify audio format use af_Wav or af_Ogg WAV file goes in mission folder named: Mission Name.filename.wav. OGG file goes in mission folder named: Mission Name.filename.ogg. Will not play if the location is not revealed to the player (will start playing automatically when it is revealed). Higher aVolume range is allowed than PlaySound as positional sounds are quieter. If looped, the sound will continue to loop if the game is paused and will restart automatically when the game is loaded.
Plays WAV audio file. If the player index is -1 the sound will be played to all players. Mono and stereo WAV files are supported. WAV file goes in mission folder named: Mission Name.filename.wav

Plays WAV audio file at a location on the map. If the player index is -1 the sound will be played to all players. Radius specifies approximately the distance at which the sound can no longer be heard (normal game sounds use radius 32). Only mono WAV files are supported. WAV file goes in mission folder named: Mission Name.filename.wav. Will not play if the location is not revealed to the player. Higher volume range is allowed than PlayWAV as positional sounds are quieter

Plays looped WAV audio file at a location on the map. If the player index is -1 the sound will be played to all players. aRadius specifies approximately the distance at which the sound can no longer be heard (normal game sounds use aRadius 32). Only mono WAV files are supported. WAV file goes in mission folder named: Mission Name.filename.wav. Will not play if the location is not revealed to the player (will start playing automatically when it is revealed). Higher aVolume range is allowed than PlayWAV as positional sounds are quieter. The sound will continue to loop if the game is paused and will restart automatically when the game is loaded.
Same as PlayWAV except music will fade then mute while the WAV is playing, then fade back in afterwards. You should leave a small gap at the start of your WAV file to give the music time to fade

Plays looped audio file. If the player index is -1 the sound will be played to all players. Mono or stereo WAV files are supported. WAV file goes in mission folder named: Mission Name.filename.wav. The sound will continue to loop if the game is paused and will restart automatically when the game is loaded.
Removes road
Sets whether the player is allowed to trade the specified resource.
Displays a message to a player. If the player index is -1 the message will be shown to all players.
Displays a message to a player with formatted arguments (same as Format function). If the player index is -1 the message will be shown to all players.

Param.name: Params: array of const; //Array of arguments

Overload.descr: Displays a message to a player with a goto button that takes the player to the specified location. If the player index is -1 the message will be shown to all players.

Displays a message to a player with formatted arguments (same as Format function) and a goto button that takes the player to the specified location. If the player index is -1 the message will be shown to all players.

Param.name: Params: array of const; //Array of arguments

Overload.descr: Stops playing a looped sound that was previously started with either Actions.PlayOGGLooped or Actions.PlayOGGAtLocationLooped.

Param.name: aSoundIndex: Integer; //value that was returned by either of those functions when the looped sound was started.

Overload.descr: Stops playing a looped sound that was previously started with either Actions.PlayWAVLooped or Actions.PlayWAVAtLocationLooped.

Param.name: aSoundIndex: Integer; //value that was returned by either of those functions when the looped sound was started.

Overload.descr: Stops playing any sound that was previously started by any of PlayWAV***, PlayOGG*** or PlaySound*** functions

Param.name: aSoundIndex: Integer; //value that was returned by either of those functions when the sound was started.

Overload.descr: Sets whether the specified player can train/equip the specified unit type
Makes the specified unit face a certain direction. Note: Only works on idle units so as not to interfere with game logic and cause crashes. Returns true on success or false on failure.
Dismiss the specified unit
Makes the specified unit 'dismiss' command available
Cancel dismiss task for the specified unit
Heals/Wounds specified unit for aHP HP
Makes the unit invulnerable. Such unit can not be killed or die from hunger.
Sets the hunger level of the specified unit in ticks until death
Kills the specified unit. Silent means the death animation (ghost) and sound won't play
Order the specified unit to walk somewhere. Note: Only works on idle units so as not to interfere with game logic and cause crashes. Returns true on success or false on failure.
Returns absolute value of specified integer
Returns absolute value of specified single number
Checks how many times specified string comes in requested array
Checks how many times specified boolean comes in requested array
Checks how many times specified integer comes in requested array
Checks how many times specified single comes in requested array
Checks whether requested array has specified string
Checks whether requested array has specified boolean
Checks whether requested array has specified integer
Checks whether requested array has specified single number
Removes element on specified index in specified array of integer. Integer array should be declared as TIntegerArray instead of array of integer.
Removes element on specified index in specified array of string. String array should be declared as TAnsiStringArray instead of array of AnsiString.
Return string representation of Boolean value: 'True' or 'False'
Returns the closest to aValue integer that is in interval [aMin..aMax]
Returns the closest to aValue single number that is in interval [aMin..aMax]
Wrapper for pascal Format function Formats aFormatting string with specified aData array of parameters
Checks condition aBool and returns aTrue/aFalse string depending on check result
Checks condition aBool and returns aTrue/aFalse integer depending on check result
Checks condition aBool and returns aTrue/aFalse single number depending on check result
2D variant of InRange, can be used for unit locs checks
2D variant of InRange
Checks whether specified aValue is in interval [aMin..aMax]
Checks whether specified aValue is in interval [aMin..aMax]
Returns point record with specified coordinates
Returns max number of two specified
Returns max number of array elements
Returns max number of array elements
Returns max number of two specified
Returns min number of two specified
Returns min number of array elements
Returns min number of array elements
Returns min number of two specified
Exponentation, base 'Base' raised to power 'Exp'. F.e. Power(3, 2) = 3^2 = 9 Returns base ''Base'' raised to power ''Exp''
Returns A^2 = A*A
Returns sum of the elements of requested array
Returns sum of the elements of requested array
Converts game ticks count into string: HH:MM:SS Can be used for scripted timers
